When the user begins the MultiMahjongClient program, they will be able to choose to create a new multi player game, to create a new single player game, to join an existing multi player game, or to quit the program.
Any user who creates or joins a game will be able to upload their own JPEG or GIF image that they wish to have displayed above their name, if they do not wish to use a preset icon.
The MultiMahjongClient will retrieve other players' changes in the game situation from the MultiMahjongServer.

Users of any MultiMahjongClient previously connected to the game will have the choice to quit the program or to begin/join a new game.

The Clarus system shall calculate derived environmental data from observations.
The Clarus system shall accept atmospheric condition data derived from atmospheric images.
The Clarus system shall process data as they are received.
The Clarus system shall accept environmental data from maintenance and construction vehicles.
The Clarus system shall implement continuous quality control processes.
The Clarus system shall apply appropriate quality checks based on the completeness of received sensor station metadata.
The Clarus system shall be able to implement quality control rules specific to observation locations.
The Clarus system shall be able to provide sensor equipment data in response to a request.
The Clarus system shall not require approval to request environmental data.
The Clarus system baseline data types shall be defined by the NTCIP ESS 1204 standard for data collection.
The Clarus system shall acquire, process, and disseminate atmospheric metadata.
The Clarus system shall acquire, process, and disseminate environmental sensor station metadata.
The Clarus system shall be able to communicate with an individual ESS through its native interface.
The Clarus system shall respond to queries for environmental data from the available data.
The Clarus system shall provide a user interface for system administration.
The Clarus system shall use software that implements industry accepted standard interfaces.
The Clarus system shall be able to notify subscribers when data sets become available.
The Clarus system shall be able to collect data from sources within 5 minutes of them becoming available.
The Clarus system shall be able to handle three hundred simultaneous requests for environmental element data.
The Clarus program shall maintain continuous 24x7 operations.
The Clarus program shall provide for customer service.
The Clarus program shall provide documentation of Clarus standards.

The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect probe vehicle data from Southeast Michigan Snow and Ice Management (SEMSIM) using the SEMSIM interface.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect probe vehicle data from the MDOT fleet using the MDOT probe vehicle data interface.

The DUAP System shall collect roadway traffic data.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect roadway traffic data from NAVTEQ Corporation’s Traffic.com using the Traffic.com interface.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect road condition data from Traffic Management Systems (TMS) using the TMS interface.

Policy Repository virtualizes all of the policies within a peering arrangement including PWS, PM, and PP, along with any delegated policies for resources as a result of the peering arrangement.
Peering Agent is used as a conduit by the mediator to establish negotiations with Peering Agent of other peers and to acquire resources from them.
The interaction protocol between Web Server - Service Registry, Service Registry - mediator is defined.
The mediator instance obtains resource and access information from the Service Registry and policy information from Policy Repository to establish negotiation.
Local Peering Agent in conjunction with the mediator interacts with external Peering Agent through inter-Peering Agent communication protocol.
Peering Agent exchange content availability and load information to identify an optimal peer to handle user requests.

Customer Service Representative: A member of the Construction Junction staff who works in the customer service desk and performs specific tasks such as constituent and member database management, item returns processing, creating drop-off acquisitions, and others.
Donor: An individual or organization who donates items to the Construction Junction inventory and receives a tax deduction for doing so.
The system should integrate with Construction Junction's website and allow, in addition to capacity outlined in later sections, the ability for customers to view and search CJ's inventory online.
The system should allow Construction Junction to reward customers for frequent donating by giving them in-store credit that can be used when purchasing items.
